main event: Three objects were observed on radar and visually by a crew in the Bering Sea Area, moving in a westerly direction at an estimated speed of 600 knots on January 11, 1958.
interesting points: The objects appeared to be stationary at first before moving quickly,The crew reported a vapor trail from one object,Four crew members reported the sighting,No physical evidence or photographs were found to support the sighting,Investigations yielded no known aircraft in the area at the time of the sighting.
sighted object: three unidentified flying objects in triangular formation
witness description: crew members from a US Navy patrol plane
